evs.analysisunits.scale
Class TemporalSupport

java.lang.Object
  evs.analysisunits.scale.Support
      evs.analysisunits.scale.TemporalSupport

public class TemporalSupport
extends Support

Temporal support of a variable, including the integration volume.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

Constructor Detail

TemporalSupport

public TemporalSupport(java.lang.String measurementUnits)
Constructs a temporal support object where the support is effectively infinitesimal (i.e. at the point support). Specify the measurement units.

Parameters:
measurementUnits - the attribute units

TemporalSupport

public TemporalSupport(java.lang.String measurementUnits,
                       Function measurementFunc,
                       java.lang.String targetUnits)
Constructs a temporal support object where the support is effectively infinitesimal (i.e. at the point support). Specify the measurement units.

Parameters:
measurementUnits - the attribute units
measurementFunc - the function required to arrive at the stated attribute values (e.g. FunctionLibrary.mult(1.0))
targetUnits - the target measurement units

                       java.lang.String temporalUnits,
                       java.lang.String aggregationFunction)

Parameters:

temporalAggregation - the period of aggregation

canChangeSupport

public static boolean canChangeSupport(TemporalSupport origS,
                                       TemporalSupport reqS)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns true if the original support can be changed to the required support and false otherwise. Currently returns true if both support objects are instances of TemporalSupport, the required temporal support is larger than the existing support, they have the same attribute units (or target units, if defined) and the original support is either instantaneous or both support objects represent totals over their input periods and these periods are exactly divisible.

Parameters:
origS - the original support
reqS - the required support
Returns:
true if a change of support is possible, false otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the input object is a temporal support object and the instance variables are identical to those of the current support object. Otherwise returns false.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
true if the objects are equal

public int hashCode()
Override hashcode: not implemented.

Returns:
a hashcode

equalsAggregation

public boolean equalsAggregation(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the input object is a temporal support object and the following parameters are equal: 1) temporalPointSupport OR If not at the temporal point support: 2) temporalAggregation (length of time) 3) temporalUnits (units of time, e.g. hours) 4) aggregationFunction (function over length of time, e.g. mean)

Returns:
true if the objects are conditionally equal

equalsOnUnitChange

public boolean equalsOnUnitChange(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the input object is a temporal support object and is equal to the current unit. If the target support is defined, the target support takes priority when checking for equality.

Returns:
true if the objects are conditionally equal

equalsExceptMeasUnits

public boolean equalsExceptMeasUnits(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the input attribute is a temporal support object and the instance variables are identical to those of the current support object apart from the measurement units and any notes, which may change.

Parameters:
obj - the input object
Returns:
true if the objects are conditionally equal
